sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Cramer's rule
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using Cramer's rule: 

2x + 3y + z = 8 

4x - 2y + 7z = 1 

x + 2y - 3z = -6
message_2:
To solve the given system of linear equations using Cramer's rule, we first need to find the determinant of the coefficient matrix (D), and then the determinants of the matrices obtained by replacing each column with the constants (Dx, Dy, Dz). Finally, we will find the values of x, y, and z by dividing the determinants of the matrices by the determinant of the coefficient matrix.

The coefficient matrix and its determinant (D) are:

| 2  3  1 | 
| 4 -2  7 | = (2(-2)(-3) + 3(7)(4) + 1(1)(1)) - (1(-2)(7) + 3(4)(1) + 1(1)(-3)) = 6 + 84 + 1 - 14 - 12 + 3 = 68
| 1  2 -3 |

Now, we will find the determinant of the matrix obtained by replacing the first column with the constants (Dx):

| 8  3  1 | 
| 1 -2  7 | = (8(-2)(-3) + 3(7)(1) + 1(1)(1)) - (1(-2)(7) + 3(1)(1) + 1(1)(-3)) = 48 + 21 + 1 - 14 - 3 + 3 = 56
| -6  2 -3 |

Next, we will find the determinant of the matrix obtained by replacing the second column with the constants (Dy):

| 2  8  1 | 
| 4  1  7 | = (2(1)(-3) + 8(7)(4) + 1(1)(1)) - (1(1)(7) + 8(4)(1) + 1(1)(-2)) = -6 + 224 + 1 - 7 - 32 + 2 = 182
| 1 -6 -3 |

Finally, we will find the determinant of the matrix obtained by replacing the third column with the constants (Dz):

| 2  3  8 | 
| 4 -2  1 | = (2(-2)(1) + 3(1)(4) + 8(1)(1)) - (8(-2)(1) + 3(4)(8) + 1(1)(-2)) = -4 + 12 + 8 + 16 - 96 + 2 = -62
| 1  2 -6 |

Now, we can find the values of x, y, and z by dividing the determinants of the matrices by the determinant of the coefficient matrix:

x = Dx / D = 56 / 68 = 14 / 17
y = Dy / D = 182 / 68 = 91 / 34
z = Dz / D = -62 / 68 = -31 / 34

So, the solution to the given system of linear equations is:

x = 14/17, y = 91/34, and z = -31/34.
